boardgame.name: Halflings II
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a pack containing 80+ Halflings

They come in 14 armor/clothing styles, including all armor types from out favourite RPG system’s source book.

There are many different variations.

boardgame.name: Halflings I
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These smallfolk are ready to go on an adventure!

This is a pack of 90 halfling & gnome ladies.

All 12 armor types from our favourite RPG system's source book.
Many variations with different weapons, and props.

There are wizards, warriors, sorcerers, adventurers, travelers, and tavern patrons.

boardgame.name: Heroes 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More Heroes have arrived to fight the evil of your world! The Dragonborn and the Firbolg.

All Dragonborn tokens have a variation for each of the Dragon types that exist in our favourite RPG source book. The variations include different weapons and spells.

Included are Dragonborn in Full Plate Armor, Chain Mail, and Scale Mail. There is a Dragonborn Bard with a Lute, and a lightly armored Barbarian.

The Firbolg tokens include Druids, Rangers, and Barbarians.

boardgame.name: Forest Creatures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Some of the greatest fantasy adventures take place in a forest. Many of these wood creatures are considered classic fantasy creatures.

The forest can be beautiful and wonderous, being the home of fey creatures such as pixies, sprites, and redcaps. You might even stumble across an unicorn, or faerie dragon.

But the forest can also be dark and dangerous. There are giant spiders, trolls, and hags.

Or it can be a little bit of both. Cute and dangerous like an Owlbear.

boardgame.name: Swamp Creatures
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Within seconds, the once quiet waters of the swamp, splash up. You see the jaws of an ancient looking crocodile coming towards you. You smell its rotten and metalic breath, in the moment before it tries to bite down on your body..

The swamps and marshes are treacherous places. Noone really knows what is lurking in the murky waters.

Lizardfolk
This pack contains everything you need to populate your lizardfolk village. Shamans, warriors, hunters, rogues. There are totem wards and eggs.

Swamp Monsters
There are giant snakes, beetles, stirges, and crocodiles. These creatures make great random encounters when your player characters are traveling through swampy areas.

boardgame.name: Thugs and Thieves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Say hello to my little friends...

Every campaign needs a villain, and every villain needs some henchmen. This pack is filled with thugs and thieves that can bother your players.

They can work for a single villain or a criminal organization such as a thieves guild.

boardgame.name: Oozes and Fungus
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

If you are planning an adventure in dark and wet locations such as caves and sewers, these oozes and fungi will make great encounters for your adventurers.

This pack has got you covered with all kinds of oozes, slimes, jellies, puddings, and other icky creatures such as the famous Gelatinous Cube, Black Pudding, Gray Ooze, and Ochre Jelly.

It includes mushrooms and fungus creatures such as the Myconid, the noisy Shrieker mushrooms, and the incredibly dangerous Corpse flower.

boardgame.name: Greater Undead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

15 unique, high level Undead for your players to fight with.

If you are playing a gothic fantasy game, you are in luck! This pack contains four variations of vampires, including noblemen, spellcasters, and warriors.

Fighting deep underground? The Observer Zombies and Death Tyrants will be excelent enemies for your party.

Is your group exploring a desert tomb? Then we have Mummy Lords and Mummy Queens.

But if you really want to give your players a hard time.. have them encounter the Lich, in their classic, Demilich, or Dracolich form.

boardgame.name: Sci-Fi I
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These Sci-Fi tokens are created to resemble different types of aliens, androids, and humans.

I hope you will take them on a great science fiction adventures, exploring alien artifacts, investigating abandoned space stations, and traveling to far away planets on epic starship journeys.

boardgame.name: Townsfolk I
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Are you looking for some colorful NPC's to fill your villages and towns? Look no further! How about a Goblin Fisherman, or a Firbolg Ventriloquist? Need some illegal potions from the black market? Our Thief Fence has got you covered.

boardgame.name: Lesser Undead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Undead are one of my favorite encounters in roleplaying games. They are reanimated by supernatural forces, and have a mission. Their mission can be what their master instructed them, or just simply, eating your brains.

Lock your heroes up in a country house and have them be swarmed by a horde of zombies. Or maybe your adventurers are haunted by spirits from their past. This pack contains enough challenges to keep your players entertained for a while :). Enjoy!

boardgame.name: Feb 04, 2022
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Strange Dark Ruins

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #05
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #5. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Old School Blue Map #06
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This PDF contains Old School Blue Map #6. The PDF has multiple layers allowing the options for numbered/non-numbered areas, secret doors on/off, and grid/no grid and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The February 18, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The February 25, 2022 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Escape Room: Spillet 2
boardgame.description:
Race against the clock: you have 60 minutes to enter the correct keys on the Chrono decoder to escape. It will count down remaining time, and emit intense sounds to let you know you’re almost out of time. Can you escape?

4 exciting escape rooms with varying levels of difficulty. Work together to escape from Murder Mystery, Secret Agent, The Dentist, and Space Station.

Note: This is the Norwegian version wich contains an additional case, The Murder Mystery wich seperates it from:
Escape Room: The Game (Escape Rooms II)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Escape Room: The Game – Murder Mystery
Escape Room: The Game – Secret Agent
Escape Room: The Game – Space Station
Escape Room: The Game – The Dentist

boardgame.name: Kolumari
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Kolumari, hideous goblin-like creatures that have toxic blood and voracious appetites. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Komoa
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Komoa, powerful plains-romaing bears. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Sun Hawk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Sun Hawk, a heavenly messenger that takes the shape of a fearsome bird of prey. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping one into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: The Doorman
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Doorman, a magical construct that serves at the whims of the ultra-rich, and magically inclined. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Drakken
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Drakken, exotic pet versions of much larger and imposing dragons. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Stone Serpent
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Stone Serpent, elemental monsters who love nothing more than to crush the life out of their victims. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Psychic Butterfly Swarm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Psychic Butterfly, an entrancing and dangerous creature from the lands of Fae. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: Carrion Makers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part of the Monstrum Liber series, this single showcases the Carrion Maker, violent and hungry fiends posing as crows and ravens. Featuring a stat block for use with the world's most popular RPG, this mini also comes with a background and history of the creature, plus two encounter suggestions for dropping them into your next adventure.

boardgame.name: For Beginners
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With this first edition you get fourteen new monsters with stat blocks for use with the world's most popular RPG. Each monster also contains a detailed description and history section, in addition to two different encounter suggestions, making it easier than ever to drop one of these new monsters into your latest campaign. These monsters all range in CR between 1/8 and 2, making them excellent for throwing at adventuring parties between 1st and 4th level.

Whether you're looking for some fresh takes on old monsters, or something entirely new and unexpected to throw at your players, this first volume of the Monstrum Liber has something for you!

boardgame.name: Forest Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Forest Camp is a 24x18 battlemap that's compatible with any tabletop roleplaying game and is perfect for printing at home (or at your local print shop) or uploading for use with any virtual tabletop (VTT) platform.

Summary
This camp is built into the ruins of a crumbling citadel in the depths of an expansive forest. Whoever built it has made excellent use of the existing features, whilst adding a wooden stakewall and other fortifications to further bolster the site's defenses. The camp is well-equipped, benefitting from a wall, multiple sheltered areas, ample space, a stables, and even a cell for prisoners.

This location could easily serve as a den for the disreputable or a nest for all manner of ne'er-do-wells, a bastion of safety in an otherwise dangerous woodlands, or a small trading post where the PCs can barter or seek shelter for the night.

boardgame.name: Glade Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Glade Camp is an 18x12 battlemap that's compatible with any tabletop roleplaying game and is perfect for printing at home (or at your local print shop) or uploading for use with any virtual tabletop (VTT) platform.

Summary
This small camp has been established in a small woodland glade within a good-sized thicket or woodland. Although the terrain around the camp is reasonably open and clear of denser vegetation, the camp is simplistic and remains vulnerable to attack from any direction. It is formed of a large lean-to, several scattered bedrolls, boxes and crates used as tables, and a fireplace elevated atop a small mound.

This location could serve bandits laying low after a heist, as a stopover for a gang fleeing a region, or as a temporary shelter for any guests of the forest; whether they're antagonists, NPCs, or the PCs themselves.

boardgame.name: Mountain Trail Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mountain Trail Camp is an 18x12 battlemap that's compatible with any tabletop roleplaying game and is perfect for printing at home (or at your local print shop) or uploading for use with any virtual tabletop (VTT) platform.

Summary
This small camp lurks amongst craggy tors, rocky peaks, and hazardous mountain passes. Hidden in a cleft, the camp is a step removed from the howling winds, dizzying heights, and sheer drops found just beyond its perimeter. Several tents, a lookout tower, and a small cavern form the camp.

The location could easily serve as a base for alpine raiders or a reclusive gang who favor the mountain air; or as a waystation for hikers, climbers, and ambitious ramblers.

boardgame.name: Desert Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Desert Camp is a 24x18 battlemap that's compatible with any tabletop roleplaying game and is perfect for printing at home (or at your local print shop) or uploading for use with any virtual tabletop (VTT) platform.

Summary
This camp is found in the ruins of an old settlement beside the skeletal remains of a great and terrible dragon. The site itself is located in a barren desert and the camp includes a cave network that runs beneath the sand bank where the ancient wyrm's skull now rests. The camp is formed from the aforementioned cave, a lean-to, several tents and yurts, and a pair of wooden watch towers.

This location could easily serve as the base of operation for some desert ruffians or dune raiders, the base camp for a team of archaeologists that are exploring and excavating the surrounding ruins, or the site of a band of cryptbreakers or tomb robbers eagerly plundering any nearby valuables.

boardgame.name: Dustbowl Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dustbowl Camp is an 18x12 battlemap that's compatible with any tabletop roleplaying game and is perfect for printing at home (or at your local print shop) or uploading for use with any virtual tabletop (VTT) platform.

Summary
This small camp can be found in the midst of an arid and desolate wasteland. Buffered from the worst of the elements, the camp is surrounded by towering standing stones and loose rocks. A small lean-to provides basic shelter for several of the camp's residences, while a larger central yurt offers accommodation for another four.

This location could easily serve as a retreat for cutpurses (and cut-throats), a temporary shelter for a nomadic desert people, or a base camp for the PCs; tended to and watched over by an NPC ally of theirs.

boardgame.name: Coastal Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Coastal Camp is a 24x18 battlemap that's compatible with any tabletop roleplaying game and is perfect for printing at home (or at your local print shop) or uploading for use with any virtual tabletop (VTT) platform.

Summary
This camp is found on the golden sands of a small seaside cove—nestled between waters to the south, steep cliffs to the north, and slippery boulders and teeming rock pools to the east and west. The camp itself is formed from a yurt, lean-to, and numerous tents, a cave, and a wooden overwatch; and has three smaller rowing boats to allow those who reside here to come and go.

This location could easily serve as a retreat for pirates, mutineers, or deserters; a camp used by fisherman, or a remote hideaway for the PCs and their allies.

boardgame.name: Swamp Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Swamp Camp is an 18x12 battlemap that's compatible with any tabletop roleplaying game and is perfect for printing at home (or at your local print shop) or uploading for use with any virtual tabletop (VTT) platform.

Summary
This boggy campsite is set in an oppressive marshland rife with fetid mud and incessant overgrowth. Its remote location and inhospitable terrain keep it warded from prying eyes, while the broken wreckage of a ship along its shores provides excellent housing for its residents.

This location could easily serve as the concealed hideout for violent offenders, the lair of a swamp hag or even a coven, or a refuge for local hunters or people eking out a miserable existence in the swamp.

boardgame.name: Magento's Marvellous Waxworks (PF1)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Magento's Marvellous Waxworks, a premium adventure module for a party of 3-5 players of 1st-level that will see the PCs reach 3rd- or even 4th-level by its conclusion.

The adventure tells the strange and whimsical tale of a prolific sculptor whose waxwork creations come alive and turn on him. It opens with the PCs attending an exclusive masquerade ball—either as guests or 'the help'—that is beset by bizarre wax sculptures of exotic animals which have inexplicably come to life. It then sees them journey to the strange waxwork museum of the sculptures' eccentric creator, Magento Baronus, before finally tracing the origins of the mysterious material to a nearby warehouse where the PCs are able to resolve the curious case of the wacky wax once and for all.

At a glance, Magento's Marvellous Waxworks is...


An unforgettable, one-of-a-kind adventure with high production values
Chock full of gorgeous illustrations and detailed maps, all exquisitely presented
Complete with comprehensive appendices that take a deep dive into the living wax that features so prominently throughout the adventure, including guidelines for making original waxwork sculpts or converting existing creatures
Inclusive of statistical information for 34 characters and creatures that feature throughout the adventure

boardgame.name: Magento's Marvellous Waxworks (PF2)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Magento's Marvellous Waxworks, a premium adventure module for a party of 3-5 players of 1st-level that will see the PCs reach 3rd- or even 4th-level by its conclusion.

The adventure tells the strange and whimsical tale of a prolific sculptor whose waxwork creations come alive and turn on him. It opens with the PCs attending an exclusive masquerade ball—either as guests or 'the help'—that is beset by bizarre wax sculptures of exotic animals which have inexplicably come to life. It then sees them journey to the strange waxwork museum of the sculptures' eccentric creator, Magento Baronus, before finally tracing the origins of the mysterious material to a nearby warehouse where the PCs are able to resolve the curious case of the wacky wax once and for all.

At a glance, Magento's Marvellous Waxworks is...


An unforgettable, one-of-a-kind adventure with high production values
Chock full of gorgeous illustrations and detailed maps, all exquisitely presented
Complete with comprehensive appendices that take a deep dive into the living wax that features so prominently throughout the adventure, including guidelines for making original waxwork sculpts or converting existing creatures
Inclusive of statistical information for 34 characters and creatures that feature throughout the adventure

boardgame.name: Golem Factory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a golem factory map?

This factory is filled with moulds for golems, glowing forges, actual golems, and shipping crates to send them out in. A conveyor belt runs through the whole factory, helping those manufacturing the golems do so efficiently at every step of the assembly line. There’s even a little office in the back for administrative tasks!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt that raises questions regarding the nature of golem consciousness and their obedience, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Feywild Ruined Crystal Manor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a ruined manor in the fairy realms?

In this map, everything is a little off—as it should be, in such a magical place. The lush forests outside are vibrant and flicker slightly with rainbow hues, as do the crystals and babbling brooks (don’t listen to their lies). The ruined crystal manor is filled with rubble, and ancient sword, and a strange circular artefact of unknown power.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring the God of Madness (he strikes again!), you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Bloodwood's Ruined Crystal Castle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a creepy red manor made out of crystal and surrounded by an even creepier environment?

Ok, maybe not—that is, after all, incredibly specific. BUT this map will do the job of setting a very uncanny mood in any session you use it in. There’s a waterfall of blood pooling into a lake below, red crystals growing from the ground, red-tinged plants, and even a devil statue within the castle. Not to mention the infernal blade!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt where this location is a magical prison, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Black Crystal Quarry Internment Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for an internment camp where they force prisoners into manual labour?

There is so much opportunity for this map. It’s got two separate wings for prisoners (you can make one wing a death sentence for the weak prisoners, for historical realism), black crystal to mine (which could be a dangerous substance that slowly kills the prisoners through exposure), dangerous scaffolding above the quarry, and austere living areas for the warden and guards.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt involving the moral quandary of prisoners forced into manual labour (our other map, Ruins of Black Crystal Quarry, has an adventure about gulags), you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Ruins of Black Crystal Quarry
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a ruined quarry?

This map is abandoned, but austere. A large building above the quarry is in ruins, the rickety scaffolding outside in shambles, yet there’s plenty of dour, black stone below waiting to be mined. What happened here? Why is it abandoned? And why is there such an uninviting overcast to the whole area?

In our adventure prompt, this map is the memory of an internment camp. There, political prisoners would be forced to labour on despite starvation, while the weak would be killed. It’s dark and grimy, and this unsettling map made the perfect setting for it.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt (inspired by Man’s Search for Meaning and the author’s experiences in Auschwitz), you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun yet moving session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Crystal Bay Slaver's Hold
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a slaver’s hold on one of the most beautiful bays you’ve ever seen?

The gorgeous, transparent waters that are absolutely filled with underwater sea life, make the large slavery complex above it a stark contrast. Timber piers and stone lookouts stand ready to welcome incoming shipments, while inside, two wings of prison cells welcome unwilling “guests”.

There are austere chambers for the slavers, a food storage room, and living areas within the hold. Beyond it, luscious forest waits, with colourful crystals scattered throughout.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a Prince with a heart of gold, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Underwater Ruined Crystal Palace
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a crystal palace under the ocean?

These ruins of an underwater crystal palace have become overgrown with seaweed and coral, while schools of fish dart throughout their halls. Nestled into an underwater valley, tall stone cliffs rise on either side of the castle, while lookout towers keep watch.

Strange crystals grow in the nearby area, while at the heart of the palace waits a giant clam.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt featuring a cute monster-girl, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

Download this map now and get ready for adventure!

boardgame.name: The Dungeons & Dragons Tarot Deck
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Featuring all-new illustrations and a short guide to tarot, this 78-card deck aligns iconic Dungeons & Dragons characters and creatures with the Major and Minor Arcana of tarot.

This officially licensed tarot deck pays homage to the lore of Dungeons & Dragons by pairing characters and encounters with the Major and Minor Arcana of tarot. The characters of the Major Arcana align to the Rider-Waite Tarot while the suits of the Minor Arcana are mapped to abilities within the game of D&D. Beautifully illustrated with exclusive art, the deck also includes a booklet that introduces players to tarot, explains the meanings of the cards, and includes prompts to add dynamic twists to your gameplay, making this the ultimate collectible for dungeon masters, players, and fans of RPGs.

boardgame.name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Track Events Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description: A mini-expansion of eight event cards for Long Shot: The Dice Game, initially offered as a stretch goal in the Kickstarter campaign. Each card features a unique condition that changes the game. Select two cards at random each game.

boardgame.name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Horse Set 4 Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
A mini-expansion of eight additional horse cards for Long Shot: The Dice Game, initially offered as a stretch goal in the Kickstarter campaign. Mix the cards in with other horse cards to add more variety to the game.

This set of cards is distinguishable from other sets by the 'boot' icon on the cards.

boardgame.name: Long Shot: The Dice Game – Horse Set 5 Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
A mini-expansion of eight additional horse cards for Long Shot: The Dice Game, initially offered as a stretch goal in the Kickstarter campaign. This set of horse cards has a focus on the concession stand action. Mix the cards in with other horse cards to add more variety to the game.

This set of cards adds additional abilities, and is distinguishable from other sets by the 'hot dog' icon on the cards.

boardgame.name: Onimaru: Legendary Foes
boardgame.description:
The spirit-caller Kappa, the shadowmancer Kagekemono, and Ryujin, King of the Dragons, joined by three others, have emerged from the Shadow Gate to threaten the land. These Oni, along with their Hordeling followers, are hellbent on terrorizing all in their path, and they will not be easily stopped.

With these Oni components added to the game, you and your allies must work together like never before to stand a chance of defeating the Onimaru!

Take the ultimate challenge against these Legendary Foes, or mix up others to create your own circle of Oni.

boardgame.name: Onimaru: Heroes From Faraway Lands
boardgame.description:
The fierce fighting prowess of Jung Hae Jin and the magical mystic arts of Ichiro Hashi have been heard of from across the waters. These capable companions travel from their respective lands to join the fight against the Onimaru, contributing their skills to the battle.

With these two new heroes added to the game, you are able to take advantage of their unique abilities, or even use their various components to increase the customization options of any hero build.

Choose or create your hero wisely, and you and your allies may stand a chance of defeating the Onimaru!

boardgame.name: Disaster Master
boardgame.description:
A game designed to promote preparedness for natural disasters in the developing world, it was initially distributed by UNESCO in Thailand and Indonesia, but a later version was created for Pakistan as well.

Financed by Japan, it includes high-quality pieces including custom dice, a spinner, reference book and test sheets, marketed as a fun boardgame for the entire family.

The winner is whomever is able to demonstrate the best emergency preparedness in each category of disaster.

boardgame.name: The Cube: Area 51
boardgame.description:
You are a department head at Area 51, assigned to The Cube reconstruction project. Manipulate, move, tessellate, and plan as you work to rebuild the alien craft with your fellow department heads. You’re all working together to reactivate the ship, but only one of you can be the ship’s captain and interface with the companion AI! Which department will gain control over The Cube?

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

listing.notes: Title: The Cube: Area 51 Publisher: Greater Than Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Cuniculture
boardgame.description:
Cuniculture is a competitive card based boardgame, desinged to medium weight with little luck involved. Published through 'Bring Your Own Dice' and designed by Aaron Rebelo, this board game features over 50 rabbit species with an expanding market of items.

As a rabbit enthusiasts, expanding your hobby into the competitive world of rabbit ownership, you begin to understand the strengths and flaws of certain breeds and the unique traits of others. Using your knowledge of each breed it becomes your duty to utilize the short season of the summer months (rounds) to earn as much gold before the season ends. Performing the following tasks will help you become successful or slow down your competitors;
Complete your personal goals to earn some quick points.
Collect rabbit droppings and selling it as fertilizer for some quick cash.
Enter your rabbit into the show to prove you have the best of the best.
Breed your rabbits and collect handfulls of wooden rabbit tokens to sell to future enthusiasts for long term cash.
Bargain with your friends into lending you a hand or trading their finest rabbit.
Visit the market to gain a larger collection of rabbits or purchase items to increase your chances at victory.

The winner is determined by the highest point value after the 6 rounds are complete, typically reach from 30-45 minutes a game.

With bargaining incorporated into the board game, you are playing or scheming even while someone else is completing their turn, ensuring your fun does not wait for others making time seems to hop on by.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: This That & Everything: Canada
boardgame.description:
This That & Everything: Canada is all "aboot" famous landmarks, iconic people, cultural influences and more. Players race to describe people, places and things related to Canada for their teammates to guess - in 30 seconds or less! The game includes 100 double-sided cards with six subjects per card, a score pad, pencil, and 30-second sand timer.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Chińczyk Rodzina Treflików: moja pierwsza gra
boardgame.description: Chinese is the classic game for kids with the favorite characters from the Treflik Family cartoon! Help the Treffles arrange the balls by guiding them all to the center of the room. Watch out for other players who you are sure to meet along the way. Others are also in a hurry with their pawns, and meeting them will delay the order slightly. Roll the colored dice, move the balls and win! Have fun with the Treflik family. Thanks to the colorful dice, no counting skills are required.

boardgame.name: Kalejdoskop 15 Trefliki
boardgame.description:
Kaleidoscope 15 Games is a set of addictive games for the whole family, enriched with original pots that serve as pawns. Take part in an obstacle race, collect tokens, smash other people's pots and test your strength in a game of dice. The characters from the Treflik Family children's series are waiting for you!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: You Son of a Bitch, I'M IN!
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You Son of a Bitch, I'm In! is a heist based RPG, in which players will gather as a crew to rob, steal, or do whatever they need to do to get the job done! Rules light, quick, fun and easy to play with any group (minimum 3-6 players with one acting as The Boss).
boardgame.rpg: You Son of a Bitch, I'M IN!

boardgame.name: Further Horizons (#2 - Jan 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second issue of the Further Horizons magazine with gaming content for the Transdimensional Adventures RPG.


2 has the theme Science & Technology with content for various world types including more cybernetics, monsters, ideas and guidelines for using the Science skill and Super-Scientist advantage, magical items for sages, more mutation and disadvantage rules, and a mini-adventure.

boardgame.name: Further Horizons (#3 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Feb 2022 issue of Further Horizons magazine includes treasures and magic items, new races, NPCs, monsters and a mini-dungeon for use with the Transdimensional Adventures rules system.

boardgame.name: Further Horizons (#4 - Mar 2022)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

March 2022 issue - Pirates & Dinosaurs. This free supplement for the Transdimensional Adventures system includes creatures and mutations, magic items and locations either sea or saurian themed.

boardgame.name: Down the Rabbit Hole
boardgame.description:
When a string of deaths strikes the Abernathy Retirement Community, your grandfather, Edgar Mirkowsky, contacts you to help him investigate. Edgar has always dazzled the family with fanciful stories of his past as a private detective, so you can't help but wonder if this is just another wild tale fueled by his investigative fantasies. When you arrive at the retirement facility, you suddenly feel as if you've crossed into another world. Nothing seems to make sense, and the residents all feel like characters that stepped out of a book. You wonder if you have arrived at a retirement community or tumbled Down the Rabbit Hole.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: Tunnel of Love
boardgame.description:
When it was announced that real estate developer Lucas Webb was buying the abandoned Fun Town amusement park, the reception was mixed. At the project launch party held at the park, Webb wandered off with his long-time girlfriend and never returned. His body was later discovered in the old Tunnel of Love ride, and his girlfriend was nowhere to be found. Who killed Lucas Webb and why? Hold on tight, this mystery is going to be a bumpy ride!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: High Stakes
boardgame.description:
A frantic woman comes in first thing Monday morning begging you to take her case. Charlotte Moralis hasn’t heard from her husband, George Moralis, in over 24 hours. This past weekend George was on a getaway to The Velvet Curtain Casino. The last she heard from him was a voicemail telling her he was in some kind of trouble. Charlotte tried calling the police, but they wrote off her case. She insists that while George may have a gambling problem, he would never abandon his family. The casino has unsurprisingly been completely unhelpful when she called. So, you decide it’s best to go undercover and see just how high the stakes are.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: Suited for Death
boardgame.description:
Dapper Gentlemen's Shop is one of the most respected men's clothing stores in all of Valley Falls. Its reputation, however, has become tarnished after two recent murder victims were found dressed in Dapper Gentlemen's suits. As a result, its employees have gone from being viewed as respected tailors to being viewed as the prime suspects in these gruesome killings. Uncover what is actually going on behind the scenes at this esteemed haberdashery and find out who else might be Suited for Death!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: Observer: System Redux
boardgame.description:
The year is 2084.
In a dark cyberpunk world shattered by plagues and wars, become a neural detective and hack into the minds of others.

Rebuilt and augmented for the next-generation, Observer: System Redux is the definitive vision of one of the most acclaimed cyberpunk stories in games.

boardgame.name: The Gift
boardgame.description:
As the holiday season approaches, the Valley Falls Police Department receives an early present: three dead bodies surrounded by toys and games. These “gifts” have been left by someone calling themselves The Tinkerer. Now, the killer has left a note at the Will Street Detective Agency claiming that more lives are on the line. Time is running out.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: NHL 22
boardgame.description: NHL 22 is an ice hockey simulation video game developed by EA Vancouver and published by EA Sports. It is the 31st installment in the NHL video game series and was released for the PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One and Xbox Series X/S on October 15, 2021.

boardgame.name: Till Death
boardgame.description:
It's the perfect day for a wedding at the illustrious McKinley Event Center until the groom
turns up dead just hours before he is set to walk down the aisle. Given that the only attendees are friends and family of
the couple, this case is bound to get messy. As if weddings weren't drama-filled enough, now you have to catch a killer
in addition to dealing with all the madness of the event itself. This gives a whole new meaning to 'Till Death Do They
Part.' Can you uncover who murdered the groom and why?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: A Stolen Star
boardgame.description:
A theft has occurred at the Valley Falls Mall. No stores were robbed. No products were
taken. Instead, the thief stole the heart of Christmas itself - the star from atop the mall’s giant Christmas tree. What at
first seems like a harmless prank becomes much more upon further investigation. Without the star, the Christmas Eve
light show cannot happen because the star is needed for all the other lights in the display to work. Not only will this lead
to some people losing their jobs, but it will also affect the light show fundraiser for the homeless of Valley Falls. Can you
find the star in time and help save Christmas?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: Nick Groff's Ghost Hunt: The Cleansing of Killian House
boardgame.description:
The story of Zane Killian is a dark, bloody
stain on Valley Falls history. A noted madman, serial killer, and practitioner of the black arts, Killian was a reclusive
millionaire who had inherited a fortune from his wealthy father. Since Killian’s death in the early 1900’s, many who have
set foot in the mansion have never made it out to tell about it. Many souls that have explored the dismal hallways of
Killian House have met an untimely demise, and it is believed that Zane Killian found a way to cheat death. You have
been tasked with helping famed paranormal investigator, Nick Groff, explore the Killian House and locate Killian's secret
that binds him to the house. Your investigation may involve speaking with the spirits of Killian’s victims who are still
believed to inhabit the house. No doubt, if they are able to communicate they will be too happy to share information on
how to eradicate Killian’s spirit and see justice finally served. Cleanse the house of the evil bound spirit of Zane Killian
and restore peace to this dark corner of Valley Falls.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: Double Feature: The Ventriloquist & Howl at the Moon
boardgame.description:
This featured two full games in one box!

The Ventriloquist: The police are shocked when a man walks into the police station with a bomb strapped to his chest. The mystery deepens, however, when they discover that he is simply a puppet that has been manipulated and sent there by someone calling themselves The Ventriloquist. What is The Ventriloquist's message to the Valley Falls police, and why has he taken the entire police force hostage? Don't be a dummy. Investigate this case and find out!

Howl at the Moon: Three recent deaths in Valley Falls have all thesigns of animal attacks. However, the evidence about the sort of animal that could be responsible is inconclusive. Rumors abound that the murders might have been committed by a werewolf, given that they all occurred under the light of a full moon. The local authorities, however, aren't taking that seriously. The only connection that the three victims share is their love and patronage of a local watering hole called Ernie's Bar. Can you determine who (or what) is responsible for the deaths of these three victims? Beware: this case may get a little hairy!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.

boardgame.name: Sedan 1940
boardgame.description:
"Sedan 1940" is a battalion and lower-level Operational wargame focused on the decisive action at Sedan led by Rommel in 1940, encircling the majority of the French army by driving through the Ardennes and surprising a contingent of less than stellar French divisions. The system focuses on combined arms, combat effects can vary depending on the units in a stack (also called a force). Units feature both a Primary Combat Value and a Secondary Combat Value representing different types of arms/weapons available to units, and advanced rules are available to further simulate radio issues with command and control.

Forces are activated by chit pull, activating whole divisions at a time. Each unit is allowed two basic actions or one special action. The sequence of play is unstructured, allowing movement, assaults, fire-combat and planned assaults to occur as chaotically as they did historically. Unit types range from armor, infantry, artillery, anti-tank/air, engineer, and motorized units. Units can be placed in Overwatch status allowing them to engage in Opportunity Fire using their Primary Combat Value.

Each day turn is approximately 2 hours while night turns are 4 hours for a total of 20 turns.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Joker
boardgame.description:
Experience the incredible RTP1 contest with the official Joker game. With 3 different ways to play, this board game will put your knowledge to the test with 1700 official TV show questions. Whether you play alone, in a team or train for your live participation, you'll have to go through the 12 rounds with the help of your 7 Jokers and Super Joker, in order to reach the maximum prize of €50,000

Let's play Joker!

boardgame.name: The Classless
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Looking to add some challenge to your next playthrough? Starting as one of the Classless will definitely increase the difficulty of your journey. They have started their adventure without any of the benefits that come from using parts of the Rooks. By force or by choice, they step out into the unknown.

boardgame.name: Supper at the Ravenous Castle
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Supper at The Ravenous Castle is a game written with blood and feces.
...
To play, you need: Mature friends with a strong stomach, six-sided dice, at least one copy of this game and copies of the Prisoner’s sheets.
...
It‘s a dungeon-crawling, survival-horror and eschatological horror game in a dark fantasy setting.

boardgame.name: Gargantuas of Kara-Tur
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Gargantuas of Kara-Tur are a conversion of the 2nd Edition monsters from the Monstrous Compendium.

boardgame.name: Magic Items of Kara-Tur
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Kara-Tur lies to the east of Faerûn, separated from the Sword Coast and Heartlands by hundreds of miles of desolate
Hordelands. Trade, adventurers, and artifacts occasionally find their way to Faerûn via the route known as The Golden
Way. Beyond the odd curiosity, however, little is known about these ancient cultures.

boardgame.name: Spells from Kara-Tur
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A compendium of spells converted from AD&D to 5E.

boardgame.name: More Spells from Kara-Tur
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Kara-Tur lies to the east of Faerûn, separated from the Sword Coast and Heartlands by hundreds of miles of desolate Hordelands. Trade, adventurers, and artifacts occasionally find their way to Faerûn via the route known as The Golden Way. Beyond the odd curiosity, however, little is known about these ancient cultures.

boardgame.name: Just Tell Me What to Do
boardgame.description:
Have you ever struggled with how to make a big, tough life decision like, Should I marry a mime? Or, Should I jump into a pit of sharks for Youtube???

We get it. Life is full of hard decisions, so we created a game about the BIG questions in life and then advise you with quotes from funny famous people! In Just Tell Me What to Do, a Decision Maker reads aloud a funny decision they're making each round. Other players (the "Advisors") advise them using Advice Cards from famous comedians, authors, and that wisest of sages, Anonymous.

Each player gets 45 seconds or less to argue why their advice is best, and then the Decision Maker awards the best Advisor with the Dilemma card. You win if you get 4, but honestly, it's a party game, who's keeping score?!

boardgame.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill: 3a Edizione
Betrayal at House on the Hill: 3rd Edition
Betrayal: La Casa de la Colina – 3ª edición
boardgame.description:
The House on the Hill still sits abandoned, and fearless group of explorers has been drawn to the house to discover its dark secrets. Immerse yourself in the narrative gameplay as you take on the role of one of those explorers.

The co-operative board game Betrayal at House on the Hill: 3rd Edition includes fifty haunts and dozens of danger-filled rooms that will terrify even the strongest among you. At first you'll work together, but beware...one explorer will betray the others and then the haunt begins.

This edition of the popular haunted house traitor game features content and gaming elements that help new players jump right in. So gather friends for a game night of monsters, miniatures, and modular board pieces in this immersive, story-driven hidden traitor game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Malador the Mystic
boardgame.description: Malador is an ancient sorcerer from the sunken realm of Atlantis. Once a noble protector of humanity and a scholar of mystical lore, Malador has become mad with power-lust. He wants nothing more than to wield ultimate power and be acknowledged as the supreme master of the mystic arts!

boardgame.name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Lantern Jack
boardgame.description: The mysterious guardian of Lantern Hill dates back to the Revolutionary War in Freedom City. Stories claim that Lantern Jack is the restless spirit of a colonial patriot slain by a British officer when he attempted to warn the people of the city of an attack. The truth is much darker…

boardgame.name: Friend or Foe Folio
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Friend or Foe Folio (5e) gives game master 100 named non-player characters, each with beautiful art, lore, personality traits, and a 5e statblock. These NPCs can easily be dropped into any D&D5e game with no preparation, as their motivations are clearly detailed. In addition, each NPC has unique quest hooks - quickly expand your ongoing campaign with new adventures for your players!

Friend or Foe Folio contains the following:
NAMED NON-PLAYER CHARACTERS – Introduce your players to 100 new NPCs, each with unique art, lore, and game stats.
QUEST HOOKS – Over 200 quest hooks have been included!

boardgame.name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Sub-Terra
boardgame.description: Sub-Terra is the strange realm deep beneath the surface of Earth-Prime, where the Serpent People and Morlocks engaged in a long and brutal war. It is a place of monsters, myth, and menaces spawned from both science and sorcery.

boardgame.name: Sentinels of Earth Prime: Eldritch
boardgame.description: Eldrich is the Master Mage of Freedom City. An adventuring archaeologist of the 1930s, he is the reincarnation of the Atlantean mage who imprisoned Malador the Mystic millennia ago. He defends Earth-Prime from mystical threats and is an ally of the Freedom League.

boardgame.name: Drunken Spirit
boardgame.description:
Drunken Spirit is a party-drink game where you have to beat other drunken masters to be the last one standing!

Roll the dice to determine your actions and combine it with your drunken master spirit power to make your opponents drink their shots.

Their life is based on the shots elixr. When you run out of shots (drunk it all), you've been eliminated.

Uranopolis Faction uses Iron to get other resources as their main Action on the Faction board. It also has a defense value of 4 on all its Location types, meaning stronger protection of their Production Locations and weaker protection of the Action Locations compared to their Opponents.

boardgame.name: Food Truck Rooz Race
boardgame.description:
Players draw "order" cards and race around the board to visit the corresponding restaurant locations and pickup the "order" and then get back to the center of the board to deliver them. During the game several board locations cause you to scan the card with the App to enact challenges that the players must complete to continue.

Can be played without the App, though it is recommended.

boardgame.name: Pomenia
boardgame.description:
Pomenia is a fairytale adventure game that gives you magical powers, such as social skills, emotional understanding and calmness, not to forget the motor skills.

Pomonia comes with a two sided game board that has "day" and "night" sides, which are separate games. In the "day" game players excercise their motor skills, emotional awareness and social skills, while the "night" game is more calm and silent. Day game can be played during the busy day time and the night game is meant to be played before going to sleep.

In both games players roll the dice to move and do various task, find the golden heart and save Ruttu-fairy. The player that saves the fairy is the winner.

boardgame.name: Smash Up: Disney Edition
boardgame.description:
The "shuffle building" game Smash Up begins with a simple premise: Take the 20-card decks of two factions, shuffle them into a deck of forty cards, then compete to crush more bases than your opponents! Each faction involves a different gaming mechanism, and each combination of factions brings a different gaming experience.

In Smash Up: Disney Edition, players choose two decks of fan-favorite Disney factions and combine their powers to take over bases, earn the most points, and win! Choose two from Frozen, Big Hero 6, Wreck-It Ralph, The Lion King, Mulan, Aladdin, The Nightmare Before Christmas, and Beauty & the Beast to create the most exciting team-ups imaginable!

During the game, base cards — each with their own difficulties and abilities — are at stake. By playing cards from your hand, you try to have the most powerful set of minions on a base when the base is broken. When this happens, the three most powerful players on that base score points. When a player has 15 or more points at the end of a turn, they win. If two or more players have more than 15 VP, the one with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Lupines: Tarry Not In Their Path
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This guide is for those of the Blood and written with rare techniques to defy passing or ephemeral interests. If you do not know what this means, this book cannot be for you or yours. Your interest is anathema and shall be rebuked. There will be references herein that will not make sense to you. Intent.

Rest assured that you will be punished for your misplaced attention. Extorres! Extorres!

Loquimur in lingua veteri!

The information herein is protected, and not by lock nor key. Nor cypher. Ceterae potestates. In these pages, if you wish to succeed, it is necessary to make the following preparations in the time, with the requisite solemnities and ceremonies contained and laid down with the insights of those who came before and paid with their existence.

Avakaza! Extorres! Extorres! Avakaza!

boardgame.name: Ravipeli
boardgame.description:
"The Harness Racing Game" is quite literally that. The basic game has a lot in common with TOTO-ravi and Solvalla: for example, while the number of players is limited to 8 - with everyone driving 2 or 3 horses - any number of outside players can also participate in the totalisator betting. Just as in the other two games, the rules suggest a separate 'banker' player to handle the money and bets, presumably making the game feel more thematic.

In the actual gameplay Ravipeli is quite a bit more involved, though. The most striking difference is the innovative movement technique, where instead of simply rolling and moving players must first promise a certain number of movement points, then roll 2 or 3 dice; the more they promise the faster and farther they move, but the risk of galloping also grows ever greater. Gallops bring negative points and at certain moments in the race or if happening repeatedly, may even result in disqualification. There is also a multitude of small rules on how to drive a galloping horse, how to change lanes voluntarily or involuntarily, how to drive in between and in front of other horses, etc., which imitate the real rules of harness racing (even including things like "Shouting at the horse, getting heated up") and lead either to disqualification or a fine that is taken from the offending driver's monetary prize, if they manage to reach the finish line.

The rules are a bit vague in who actually wins and how so in that sense this game aims to be more of a harness racing simulator than a competitive game.

boardgame.name: Aperture Desk Job
boardgame.description:
Aperture Desk Job reimagines the been-there-done-that genre of walking simulators and puts them in the lightning-spanked, endorphin-gorged world of sitting still behind things.

You play as an entry-level nobody on their first day at work — your heart full of hope and your legs full of dreams, eager to climb that corporate ladder. But life’s got other plans, and they all involve chairs.

Designed as a free playable short for Valve’s new Steam Deck, Desk Job walks you through the handheld’s controls and features, while not being nearly as boring as that sounds.

Not Portal 3!

Lower your expectations: This is not a sequel to Portal. Now get ready to raise them slightly, because it is in the expanded universe of those games. Desk Job puts you squarely in the driver’s seat at Aperture Science. Then quickly removes the driving part and adds a desk in front of the seat.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: 3 Pigs in a Poncho
boardgame.description:
Your brothers have gotten themselves in a heap of trouble with the Sheriff Wolf. He’s seen fit to toss all of them in jail while you were trying to build up a farm. Guess you’ll have to bust them out. If the Wolf finds your brothers though, he’ll toss them straight back in the clink. Get creative with your moves to get your farm built before your opponents. Will the Wolf be fooled if 3 pigs stack up in a poncho and make the rounds completing tasks?

In 3 Pigs in a Poncho, players will move their dice around the action rondel completing the action matching their die value then re-rolling for their next turn. 3 Pigs is at its core a farming game. Players use actions to build their hideout which gives them bonuses from bricks, sticks, and straw. But building has to be done with care, straw can stack on anything, but sticks only stack on sticks and bricks and bricks only stack on bricks.

Players also have an opportunity to raise livestock, building them stables and if they have a pair and an empty stable, they can get baby Unicorns, Llamas, and Cows!

Players also try to keep their fairy tale pals safe from the Big Bad Wolf Sheriff, Red Riding Hood, Billy goat gruff and Puss in Boots need your help!

Players will get to be strategic with their dice in that they can space the 3 pigs out on the rondel, but doing so makes them susceptible to being arrested by the Wolf who is also moving around the rondel. Or they can stack their piggies, less opportunity to get exactly the action they want, but less likely to be arrested also!

The game plays until a player has completed all 3 sections of their hideout. Then players score on their sheets. The game is a roll and write in that the players roll dice and mark their player sheet based on the actions they completed.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Pride of Mandalore Reinforcements Pack
boardgame.description:
There are no warriors in the galaxy more storied for their prowess and ruthlessness than the Mandalorians, and their kind have seen battlefields in countless conflicts from the Clone Wars to the Galactic Civil War. Mandalorians have fought alongside nearly every faction in these struggles, whether pursuing their own agendas such as the fanatical Deathwatch or unifying with causes like the Rebel Alliance.

The Pride of Mandalore Reinforcements Pack includes new ship and upgrade cards for Star Wars: X- Wing, allowing players to pilot their existing ships with new characters seen in The Mandalorian, Star Wars: The Clone Wars and Star Wars: Rebels. In addition to new pilots and upgrade cards useable by five factions; new tokens and obstacles are also included. Finally, the reinforcements pack also contains dials and ship tokens to convert the Fang Fighter over to the Rebel Alliance!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
A small expansion for KHG including 20 additional cards, more cash, rules, and a booklet with background info.

boardgame.name: Ultimate Custom Night
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the ultimate FNAF mashup, where you will once again be trapped alone in an office fending off killer animatronics! Featuring 50 selectable animatronic characters spanning seven Five Nights at Freddy's games, the options for customization are nearly endless. Mix and match any assortment of characters that you like, set their difficulty from 0-20, then jump right into the action! From your office desk, you will need to manage two side doors, two vents, as well as two air hoses, all of which lead directly into your office.

This time you will have to master other tools as well if you want to complete the ultimate challenges, tools such as the heater, A/C, a global music box, a power generator, and more. As if all of that weren't enough, you'll also need to set up laser traps in the vents, collect Faz-Coins, purchase items from the prize counter, and as always, keep a close eye on not one, but two, Pirate Cove curtains!

boardgame.name: Centipede: Recharged
boardgame.description:
The original bug-blasting arcade game is back! Centipede: Recharged has been reimagined for modern gameplay, with vibrant visuals designed for modern screens, a 16:9 field of play, and an original soundtrack from award-winning video game composer Megan McDuffee.

Aim for a high score in the old school arcade mode and earn bragging rights with your name at the top of the leaderboard. Or test your skills and rank on the boards in one of 30 intensely creative challenges, which twist the gameplay in new and exciting ways.

A dozen new power-ups can give you an edge by introducing abilities like screen-clearing explosions, rail guns, and even slowing down time. Every mode and level is playable in local co-op mode with a friend.

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: Xbox One | Xbox Series X/S downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Black Widow: Recharged
boardgame.description:
The original cult classic arachnid-starring, twin-stick shooter returns! Just in time for Halloween, Black Widow: Recharged has been reimagined for modern gameplay, with vibrant visuals, powerful new abilities, and another original soundtrack from award-winning video game composer Megan McDuffee.

Aim for a high score in the old school arcade mode and earn bragging rights with your name at the top of the leaderboard. Or test your skills and rank on the boards in one of 30 intensely creative challenges, which twist the gameplay in new and exciting ways.

Collect cash from downed enemies to charge a powerful web blast, or pick up one of a dozen new power-ups including explosive blasts, spread-shots, and fear, trapping all enemies in your web. Every mode and level is playable in local co-op mode with a friend.

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: Xbox One | Xbos Series X/S downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Spelled
boardgame.description:
Spelled is a deckbuilding word game between two or more magic-wielding witches and wizards. Each of your cards is a letter that can be spelled as a word to deal damage and gain powerful abilities. But each spell can hit just one target – so longer words aren’t always the best bet, giving a fair fight even if your opponent is a loquacious wordsmith...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Doctor Strange & Clea
boardgame.description:
Stephen Strange has had many unusual encounters, but none have tested him so much as losing his connection to the arcane power of Earth. Without his magical mastery, Stephen Strange was forced to seek out new allies and a new source of power beyond the boundaries of earth. Only then could he reclaim the title of Sorcerer Supreme.

Clea is a powerful sorceress and the disciple of Sorcerer Supreme Doctor Strange. Once she inhabited the Dark Dimension, the home to the ancient evil Dormammu. Doctor Strange pulled Clea into Earth, where she learned the mystical arts from him, becoming nearly the equal of the Sorcerer Supreme in her control over magic.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition – Rook City Renegades
boardgame.description:
Rook City. Nighttime. The Cult of Gloom performs their dark rituals, seeking to open the way for their dread lord and master. Rumors abound of a red-masked killer lurking in the shadows. A monstrous giant rat-man-beast stalks the sewers, its terrible teeth teeming with toxins. And, above it all, The Chairman of The Organization — the largest organized crime syndicate the world has ever seen — watches the ebb and flow of his underlings, his subjects, his city. If things need a more hands-on approach, he'll send his Operative to deal with the dirty work.

A few street-level heroes have teamed up, calling themselves Dark Watch. The gun-toting vigilante Expatriette has plans (and guns) for every contingency. The ancient martial artist and auto mechanic Mr. Fixer has a lifetime of experience. The cursed paranormal investigator NightMist knows countless incantations. The arcane avian apprentice The Harpy — once known as the villainous Matriarch — is now a bird of a different feather, using her magical power for good (though she still has a lot to learn about control). The hapless Setback’s luck might be bad (most of the time), but he’s the heart and soul of the team, ready to throw himself into danger without a second thought to protect others. As a team, they have a lot to offer, but they still have their work cut out for them. Perhaps they could use a little help from a new hero? Time will tell...

Sentinels of the Multiverse — Rook City Renegades expands the core game of Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition with a new mechanic (Suddenly!), 6 heroes, 9 villains, and 5 environments.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition – Rook City Renegades: Foil Promo Pack 2
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Definitive Edition
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Rook City

boardgame.name: ZOKU
boardgame.description:
Fast and Fun game where players act as Bosozoku gangs chiefs. First they send their Zokus (represented by meeples) to take control over Tokyo districts.
Then, they resolve fights between gangs by throwing the Zokus in the box !

Whoever gets more influence in Tokyo is the winner.

boardgame.name: Op RETALIATION
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mysterious arms trading organization holds a scientist’s family hostage somewhere in the former Soviet Republic of Albenistan. With little support and less information, the shadowy Clandestine Activities Special Executive sends the operators of its Detachment to affect a rescue. But the opposition is dug in. It has hired mercenaries, subverted local law enforcement, and bought off the national security forces. There are a lot of guns and not a lot of options.

The CASE Detachment may want to stay quiet and subtle, but the opposition is ready to go loud.

boardgame.name: Op REDEMPTION
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The arms traders of the world are abuzz about a new deal that is coming—someone is selling something, but the details are secret. Analysis suggests it is a weapon of mass destruction, some kind of strategic system for which many groups and even nations are vying. The sellers are mysterious, but the ripples they make in the arms underworld is significant—this is a heavy-weight, suggesting this isn’t just a rumour or a false positive. A real threat is brewing out there, but no one knows what and no one knows where.

With little intelligence a few options, the executive activates the Clandestine Activities Special Executive. CASE is beyond secret, with a budget hidden in a riddle wrapped in an enigma. It needs to find out what is being sold, who is selling it, and then stop them from doing so. The rules of engagement are there are no rules. The executive isn’t willing to risk a mass-casualty event, not anywhere in the word.
The leadership has let slip the dogs of war.

boardgame.name: Op RETRIBUTION
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The mysterious criminal network known as Technician 67 may be vulnerable. After crossing paths with a covert detachment from the Clandestine Activities Special Executive, its representatives have surfaced in the Central Asian Republic of Albenistan. With Technician 67 ready to sell weapons of mass destruction and even the scientists who create them to the highest bidder, CASE now seeks to uncover the serpent in the grass, but it may have uncovered a dragon rather than an asp. Inside hostile territory, the CASE detachment faces a ruthless adversary with immense resources.

But sometimes, the fight isn’t won by the biggest. Sometimes, the race doesn’t go to the fastest. Sometimes, it’s the will that matters.

boardgame.name: Good Hope, Crushing Despair (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Good Hope - Crushing Despair is a stand-alone product that brings expanded rules and content around hope and despair to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. It provides new conditions for despair, a new madness if using madness rules from Horror Adventures, and three deities exemplifying different facets of hope, despair and emotions including expanded rules from Pathfinder supplements revolving around deities in their base setting. Additionally, there are 30 new and revised spells, a plethora of new class options like the hope domain for the cleric or order of the iron fist for the cavalier or samurai, 3 new archetypes, new skill uses, new magic items, 4 new monsters exemplifying hope and despair and a sample NPC that inspired this book to be created. These options will bolster your allies and crush your foes. Bring the force of emotion to bear in your next game.

boardgame.name: The School of Readiness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Wazard sub-class for 5E designed specifically for type-C personalities. THis sub-class focuses on letting you pre-cast spells and set them up to trigger under certain conditions. If you are someone who likes to plan out a fight beforehand or to enfold yourself in defensive spells, this sub-class is perfect for you.

boardgame.name: Barnyard
boardgame.description:
Barnyard is an 18-card drafting game designed specifically for 2 players in which you will compete to corral the best combination of farm animals that you can. Manage an ever-shifting barnyard of animal cards and carefully wrangle the animals you want into your corral to score the most points and win the game!

On your turn, you'll choose an animal in the farm and use its power to manipulate the animals in the Barnyard line. Then, you'll flip that animal over and add it to the back of the line.

Next, you'll take whatever animal is currently at the front of the Barnyard line and add it to your corral.

Be careful! Some critters get along better than others, so you’ll have to carefully plan the layout of your corral if you want to score the most points and win the game.

Want to ramp up the complexity? Every copy of Barnyard comes with the free 6-card Farmers Expansion. Work towards your own secret corral objective to score even more points at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Land of Vampires: Campaign Conclusion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The epic, three-part conclusion to the Land of Vampires campaign!—Running from level 9-10

You've restored two of the fanes and brought back half of the Fae Sisters, and the fallen land of Steymhorod is beginning to mend.

But just as a single ray of sunlight threatened to peek through the dense clouds, tragedy struck, rendering the town of St. Sebastian forever changed.

Vengeance and retribution are the party's to mete out, though, as their time in Steymhorod has already taught them, unlikely allies often hide in plain sight.

This three-chapter arc concludes the Land of Vampires campaign with the party finally making their assault against Lord Nassarq.

Many travails stand before them, and dangers and terrors lurk inside the walls of Nassarq's tower. But the destiny that is theirs to claim waits as well.

Complete your adventures in Steymhorod with this final chapter of the Land of Vampires campaign!

boardgame.name: Hoyuk: Special Construction Cardboards
boardgame.description:
Includes 3 green and 3 yellow cardboards (tiles).

Instructions: Before the game begins, divide the construction cardboards into 2 groups: green and yellow. Place them face up next to the game board. All players can use these cardboards, but only during the construction phase. To use such a cardboard, you must buy it with victory points. Green costs 1 victory point and yellow costs 2 victory points.

This was a KS exclusive which came packaged separately from the expansion box.

boardgame.name: Shepherds
boardgame.description:
Per creators itch.io site:

"Shepherds is a tabletop RPG about young members of a League of professional do-gooders, as you strive to protect the peace and safety of ordinary people. The young Shepherds will forge bonds of trust with each other, grow and mature as people, and possibly foil some evil plots along the way.

Shepherds is an adaptation of the popular “Powered by the Apocalypse” design framework, and retains many familiar components for those who have played other PbtA games, as well as introducing a few things that won’t be so familiar. It takes its inspiration from “hopeful fantasy” JRPGs -- most particularly the Trails/Kiseki games by Falcom, and the Tales Of series by Bandai Namco.

The game is fully laid out (albeit by me), with hyperlinks, table of contents, PDF bookmarks, and a scattering of art. It is complete and fully playable, though it may receive small updates in the future.

Purchases at above list price will unlock more community copies, all proceeds will go towards more art. Thank you everyone!"

boardgame.name: Hippocrates: Game Brewer Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
Adds 3 Goal Cards with no card text. Each offers a reward to the first player who achieves that goal.

Part of a promo pack containing cards for Arkwright TCG, Rulebenders, Stroganov, Hippocrates and Paris.

listing.notes:
The three Hippocrates Promo cards only.
plus shipping IBAN payment preferred Paypal on request (family & friends only)

boardgame.name: Amsterdam: Acrylic Rondels
boardgame.description:
Replacement acrylic rondels for the standard cardboard.

The acrylic rondels fit in the Game Trayz, but only if the cardboard ones are removed.

boardgame.name: Zombie Life Insurance
boardgame.description:
Zombie Life Insurance is a card game about investing money during a zombie apocalypse to get rich and avoid getting infects. Players begin with a hand of cards and some starting money.

Players take turns collecting a salary, purchasing insurance products, playing action cards and drawing new action cards from the deck. These actions cards can grant Personal Protective Equipment, allow you to steal cards from other players, or may cause you to become infected by the virus.

Players who are completely infected can look at the action deck and remove cards, force other players to discard and rearrange the action deck.

At the end of six rounds, players who are still human will collect a survival bonus. The player with the most money is the winner.

boardgame.name: G.I. Joe Deck-Building Game: Shadow of the Serpent Expansion
boardgame.description:
The evil organization Cobra threatens the world with their schemes and it’s up to you to stop them!
In this Deck-Building game, you and your fellow players will lead teams of G.I. Joe soldiers on missions to stop Cobra’s dastardly plans! You have survived the Core Set Missions and are ready for more. This expansion includes new missions, main deck cards, Cobra Officers and Troopers, and a command center to build and protect!
This is an expansion. G.I Joe Deck-Building Game is required to play.

Features:
2 new missions!
New main deck cards including new Joes, utility items, weapons and more!
New Cobra Officers to confront and Cobra Troopers to defeat.
A Command Center to build and protect!
Includes a new Expert Mode card for even greater challenges!

—description from the publisher
